author: felixweber
title: Ecosystem Map-Community Wayfinding
description: There is a lack of data & visuals to help the community to understand & navigate the Cardano & Catalyst Ecosystem

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has provided a clear description of the issue they are trying to solve: there is a lack of data/visuals to help the community to understand the Cardano Ecosystem.

As a solution to the problem, the proposer offers to build an open-source - interactive ‘planetary’ based map of the Cardano NFT Ecosystem. I have doubts about the impact this proposal might have on the Cardano ecosystem. Who has successfully used an interactive ‘planetary’ based map previously in other domains/industries to explore an ecosystem?  The PoC provided looks nice ( and understandingly it is currently a limited, featureless, and unfinished product) but who will really use the finished version to explore the dApps and tools of the ecosystem? Beyond seeing the overall size of the ecosystem and perhaps the links between projects, what will the audience learn? With limited funding available, I would judge this visual tool as something nice to have, but definitely not critical or particularly effective towards the goal of learning about the Cardano ecosystem, and the target audience for this tool to be limited. The project does add value to the ecosystem, but does it add enough value to justify almost $100K of funding? I am not sure it does.

In my opinion, this proposal does address the challenge - but not in an effective way.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer gave a good account of what experience and skill sets will be necessary to deliver on the proposal. The proposer also described the different parties who will work on the project (Catalyst Swarm, Bridge Builders, Fluid7, AIM), their experience/skills, and roles in this project.

The budget is outlined clearly, understandable, and broken down into identifiable items (management, dev, treasury, marketing, front end dev, bounties). The budget seems to be reasonable to achieve the set goals although that is a lot of expected hours of project management and coordination versus the number of actual hours of development and front-end dev.

The proposal does offer a realistic timetable to complete the work ( 4 months) and some of the resources necessary to implement the proposal.

The main identified risk is the effective coordination & management of the participating developers which is mitigated by relying on IM’s & Fluid7’s experience and expertise.

Given the experience and plan presented, it is very likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provided a clear and detailed roadmap with milestones and actionable tasks, and a time horizon for achievement (4 months).

The KPIs to track the progress/development of the project are presented but not the KPIs to identify the success of the project ( page views, unique pageviews, unique users, time spent on page, number of people following the project, any other social or interactions KPIs).

I would therefore argue that the KPIs provided can't be used to quantify the success of the project. I would therefore rate auditability a 3/5.

f6_assessments.q0:
If funded, this proposal will have a huge impact as it will empower the NFT community which will use an intuitive tool for navigating a map representing the many projects in the ecosystem. 

The proposal is submitted in the right challenge, as it’s an external integration to both increase the project's discoverability and simplify knowledge retrieval by the end users. 

The proposed solution addresses a problem of the NFT ecosystem, and being a navigation tool is inherently scalable in nature. Moreover, I think this useful experimentation could be extended to the whole community.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project has a high likelihood of success once funded. The team is made of committed and credible community members. They are toolmakers, with a perfect mix of the experiences needed to carry out the project. As an example, the team already provided the catalyst tools used by the PAs. 

The plan of work is very detailed compared to an average project in the proposal phase, and the risks appear correctly addressed. In addition, the team already provided a PoC for the visualization of the ecosystem map. 

The timeframe is clearly stated, and the budget is explained with a detailed break-down.
f6_assessments.q2: The community can check the progress by monitoring commits on public VCS (GitLab). The project’s progress can be checked through a shared board on devwork. The financial transparency is also guaranteed by tracking and documenting transactions/payments via a publicly accessible accounting system.

f6_assessments.q0: I was so intrigued to see what SWARM was doing this time. Honestly telling you that they have plans to the next level. This proposal do address the challenge presented. I'm guessing this will come under the Social layer of the challenge. This project has the potential to help the ecosystem mature. The proposer has a clear plan on how to accommodate new projects. I feel this will solve the problem of navigation through the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The risk analysis is done, as they agree, dev teams are hard to manage in a Web3 ecosystem. Looks like they have collaboration in place to solve the potential issue. But next time, I suggest the proposer list down a few more risks they might face and the solution for it. Just gonna reduce one point for the risk analysis. But other than that, looking at the elaborate Timeline, Roles and budget breakdown, this project is highly feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: As mentioned, the elaborate timeline helps us to audit the project at every stage. I see they have allocated a decent budget for marketing outreach too. They have kept most operations of the project open source, which by default lets anyone in the community audit the progress. With everything considered, the project has a high success rate and I wish all the very best for the future endeavors of SwarmLabs.

f6_assessments.q0: Both the problem statement and the solution are presented in a straightforward and understandable manner in this proposal. According to the author of this, there is a lack of data & visuals to help the community to understand & navigate the Cardano & Catalyst Ecosystem. The core idea aims at creating an open source - interactive ‘planetary’ based map of the Cardano NFT Ecosystem With solid research & design thinking in the backend. There are justifiable reasons why this implementation is needed, and the solution is well-thought-out and addresses the mentioned problem. It is very clearly discussed, and information on the actual product as well as the process is well-served in order to be understood and assessed. The proposal's technical parts are very well described, as are the essential metrics associated with the outlined challenge settings. Based on these aspects mentioned above, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal's team has provided a good description of the team members' experience that is relevant to the project's necessary work, as well as a solid comprehension of their particular role in this implementation. A public reference to their profile, on the other hand, would have been preferable. I am unable to verify them using any of the links provided in the proposal. This is compensated by a very clear description of the executed plan, which correctly guides me on when, how, and what will happen. It is really encouraging and increases the team's stated skill to see that they have been working hard on the project and have finished all tasks in Q2 2022 and are ready to lead this project to the next steps. I'm astounded by how well the project tasks are organized. There is a reasonable timetable for completing all of the listed necessary work. The project specifies how it will be carried out and which implementation will be used. Given the timeframe and milestones, I'm quite confident in the project's viability, not to mention that the budget breakdown is handled beautifully. The team requested an amount of $91,780 to cover a timeframe of 4 months from August to November 2022 and given all the explicit details included regarding the cost for each necessary component, hourly rate for each role, and the number of working hours, I consider it to be reasonable and comprehensive. The proposers surely did well on presenting how the money was spent, which is something worth-praising.
f6_assessments.q2: The authors provide us with accurate information so that we can carry out proper monitoring. We can keep track of whether the activities outlined in the action plan were carried out properly. They not only define the objectively expected outcomes for each quarter of the roadmap, but they also go into great detail regarding each of these time periods and their respective expectations. Direct contact is made between the team and the Cardano community to demonstrate partial results. I love that the development of the Ecosystem Map is fully open source for the community to assess, KPIs & OKRs of the project can also be tracked through the verifiable references provided. They discuss in detail what scenario they hope to achieve with this proposal under the topic "what does success look like." As a result, we have a lot of content when it comes to monitoring end results, and I’m strongly in agreement that this proposal is highly audited.

f6_assessments.q0: The main goal of this project is to build a visual and interactive map depicting the landscape of the Cardano ecosystem to reduce barriers and shorten the time for new users to enter the blockchain by providing a centralized repository of learning materials about Cardano. A good starting point would be to motivate users to explore, engage, and increase engagement on the blockchain. I fully agree that this solution is viable for addressing the requirements that this challenge poses. The solution is presented clearly and has profound explanations about the architectural structure, simulation design, and how the map works. In general, the proponent has clearly outlined the project development path and predicted the risks that will be encountered, giving appropriate adjustment solutions.
f6_assessments.q1: This is a project that continues the work previously completed before the fundraising, the results of which are verifiable through the reporting link provided by the proponent. This shows that this is a reliable and capable team that develops and completes the follow-up tasks listed in the master project plan. The budget is estimated on an hourly rate basis and presented with a formula that estimates the number of hours worked for each work item x respective remuneration, which is great for professionals to do comparisons with other proposals and evaluate the reasonableness of the required budget. According to the description, the implementation team is quite young in coordination & management, but they have found themselves with support from experts in the field they are building. While it is possible to go through the results of previous work to demonstrate the ability of the people behind this project, the presentation of the team members still needs to attach their resumes like Linkedin to have can verify their role and value in this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs that you provide are merely a basis for assessing the level of work completed, but are not ideal indicators for evaluating success after the project - that is after the map is put into use. In my opinion, one of the effective indicators of success for this project is the conversion rate of users to Cardano when using the map as a resource for learning, or user experience evaluation. The tools/methods provided for the community to monitor the project are quite diverse and effective.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe this project is a very interesting one that will help users discover the cardano ecosystem in a fun interactive way. Users can have a better understanding of what the cardano community has to offer, and can contribute their time or money into projects they are interested in. It will also be very helpful to see the overall growth of cardano, through the birth of new projects. We can also visualize better which areas cardano is lacking development in, and try and amend them.
f6_assessments.q1: I believe the team is very experienced and think there will be no issue regarding that matter. The biggest challenge will be to connect to different projects of the cardano ecosystem to have them join the map. The author has prepared a marketing budget for that, with planned video content to reach out to those people, as well as bounties through tasks to further push engagement. I believe these measures will mitigate the risks of lack of engagament. The budget and timeline are very reasonable and realistic. However, the author offers no details on how the mapping will be arranged. What categories will the mapping be divided into? What are the details that will be available on the map? What are the minimum requirements to joining the map? These are very important details that need to be ironed out. Overall, I believe this project will find success in implementation, though i have reservations about whether or not it will provide the community with the most interesting information.
f6_assessments.q2: The author offers open-source code through github, updates on their social media platforms, and fund tracking through Catalysst Swarm Treasury. This combined with their given timeline will be completely sufficient to track the progress of this project. To track success, we can look at the community engagement on their different social medias, as well as how many other projects on the cardano ecosystem have joined in on the map. If the map provides relevant and interesting information to community members looking to develop projects to help further cardano,it will be a success.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal's solution is written adequately and clearly. The team develops a second generation community mapping solution focused on building an open source based interactive map of the Cardano Ecosystem. The code for the PoC and the first example map are prepared in advance. The project focuses on visualization and interaction. I highly appreciate the transparent explanation of the 3D visualization, showing the alignment between the solution to the Cardano ecosystem. Moreover, the illustrate how the proposed solution will address the Challenge make it convincing that the project will call out for builders, devs and creators to engage with Catalyst and provide value to the Cardano community, besides creating a new product that offers new and existing users of Cardano to better navigate, explore and engage with the projects and groups working on Cardano. The risk that can prevent the project from succeeding is mentioned which is effective coordination & management of the participating developers, and the proposer has given a suitable solution to the problem. Therefore I believe the proposal has an impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The detailed plan is built with an apparent timeline and key milestones. In each quarter, the proposal has listed the activities they carry out. Particularly, some parts of their project has been completed such as initiating a first Project Team & Collaboration, Creating first Project Structure on Gitlab, Creating a first PoC Ecosystem Map, Setup Project Management Structure on Swarm Dework & Discord,... This contributes to reducing the time they finish the project. Also, this shows that the proposal is clear in the way they carry out the project. The activities in each stage of the process are illustrated with the smaller tasks, making it clear about the plan they build. The budget is broken down clearly in hours. The activities in the budget breakdown are listed, which are logical, compared with the plan of the proposal. About details of the people who will work on the project, the proposal has a summary of the positions needed for the project, then the details of each member is illustrated, which is a bright point of the proposal. With the experience the team has, I believe that they will make the project successful.
f6_assessments.q2: In terms of auditability, I think the information is not adequate and transparent for the community to follow and evaluate. It is easy to understand the idea of the proposer that the people can track the project’s process via Dework & Discord Integration on the Catalyst Swarm Discord & Dework Server and the Catalyst Swarm Treasury & accounting system on Discord & Github. However, the proposal can be assessed better if the proposal provides the exact KPIs like number of users using the map or the quantity of the transactions & payments occurring. The exact KPIs give the community the indicators to based on to easily evaluate the proposal. Success of this project will be defined by an accomplishment of above mentioned KPIs & OKRs, building an inviting environment for developers, project manager & designer to engage and build in a collaborative spirit on Community Tools & platforms. That is a suitable illustration.

f6_assessments.q0:
"The demand for creating maps of projects is reasonable, since there are numerous projects in the Cardano ecosystem. For newbies, they are immersed in a huge world and as a result, they need Thus, users need a platform to categorize the projects, and help them to quickly and easily to navigate between different projects. As stated by the proposers, there were already platforms with similar ideas. The novelty of this platform was the map with interactive features (planetary features). 
The proposal idea was not so complicated, and the proposers explained well the concepts. Apart from the risks mentioned, I just wonder if this system could provide a more user-friendly platform compared to the existing ones, or the users still stay with the old platform. From my point of view, the “interacting with planets” feature may be unnecessary for some people, since most people just need tools to find projects as quickly as possible.
Nevertheless, if this platform is more successful compared to the old ones, it means that this platform is more user-friendly and convenient; thus, this platform could attract more users to join the Cardano ecosystem. From this viewpoint, the solution may be aligned with the challenge."
f6_assessments.q1:
"The in-detail roadmap comprising of several sub-tasks, along with the specific due date was provided. The explanation for the tasks were clear, proving the feasibility of the project. 
The budget breakdown was provided and quite detailed, the explanations about the budget was also given. I just have a small comment that the proposers should allocate the budget in line with the roadmap provided, for easier follow-up to improve the feasibility. From my point of view, the core team members are experienced professionals in blockchain and designing, which were necessary for doing this project. "
f6_assessments.q2: In my opinion, it was good that this project is fully open source, indicating high integrity of the founding team. The proposers provided a website for project management tracking. The general public could access to the website, and view the project progress e.g., which tasks are done in the moment. In terms of the KPIs/metrics, the proposers should state the exact KPIs/metrics for the projects, and the specific target of for them in a given time. This will increase the auditability of the project.

solution: We create an open source - interactive ‘planetary’ based map of the Cardano NFT Ecosystem With solid research & design thinking in the backend
experience: Developer, Project & Community Manager, Cardano & Catalyst OGs & committed members of the Cardano Community, Experienced Toolmakers & Funded Proposer, Stake Pool Operators and Proposal Assessors with profound experience and expertise about the Cardano Ecosystem
